content.description:
Pliny and a Parent

Castigabatcastigo, -are: to punish quidam pater filium suum quod paulo 
sumptuosiussumptuosus, -a, -um, adj.: extravagant  equos et canes emeret. Huic ego iuvene 
egresso dixi: “Heusheus: hey! (interjection to get someone’s attention) tu numquamne fecisti, quod a patre 
corripicorripio, -ere: to criticize posset?”
content.question: In this passage, Pliny implies that parents should

choices.label: be strict when correcting their children’s misdeeds
remember that children will not respond well to being punished
recall that they didn’t like to be punished when they were younger
be more understanding because they too made mistakes when they were younger

content.answer: be more understanding because they too made mistakes when they were younger
